title: About
text:
I’m a Economist (PUCP). I worked in research and insurance sector. I blog about statistics, programming, and data.
I have extensive experience with causal inference, regression analysis, spatial analysis, econometrics, actuarial analytics.
I excel at applied statistics, especially developing new methods to analyze complex data sets.
I love to collaborate with scientists and product teams on involved projects.
You can find my resume here. I’m currently based in Lima,Peru

title: Barplot with Ggplot
text:
Plot beauty barplots
We had data of admissions to UCB

library(tidyverse)
library(knitr)


db.df<-data.frame(UCBAdmissions)

kable(db.df)

A first approach

db.df                                                   %>% 
ggplot()                                                 +
geom_col(aes(Admit,Freq,fill =Gender),
         position = position_stack(reverse = FALSE),
         lwd = 3)     +
facet_wrap(vars(Dept)) +
theme_bw()+
xlab("Admition") +
ylab("Frequency")




Plot upgraded

db.df                                                   %>% 
ggplot()                                                 +
geom_col(aes(Admit,Freq,fill =Gender,color=Gender),alpha=0.5,
         position = position_stack(reverse = FALSE),
         lwd = 1.2)     +
facet_wrap(vars(Dept)) +
xlab("Admition") +
ylab("Frequency")+
scale_fill_viridis_d() +
scale_color_viridis_d()+
theme_dark()

title: Plot Time series with Ggplot
text:
Plotting Time series with ggplot
#Packages

library(tidyverse)


Load Data

db.ts <-  data.frame(discoveries) %>% 
          mutate(year = 1860:1959)



plot

db.ts                                       %>% 
ggplot(aes(year,discoveries))                +
geom_line(color="red4",lwd=0.5)                      +
geom_point(color="red4")                                 + 
theme_bw()                                   +
ylab("Discoveries ")                                    +
xlab(" ")
